metadata.title: CVE-2019-15143 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - low
metadata.description:
In DjVuLibre 3.5.27, the bitmap reader component allows attackers to causea denial-of-service error (resource exhaustion caused by aGBitmap::read_rle_raw infinite loop) by crafting a corrupted image file,related to libdjvu/DjVmDir.cpp and libdjvu/GBitmap.cpp.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-15143` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

djview - 3.5.27.1-5ubuntu0.1
djview3 - 3.5.27.1-5ubuntu0.1
djvulibre-bin - 3.5.27.1-5ubuntu0.1
djvulibre-desktop - 3.5.27.1-5ubuntu0.1
djvuserve - 3.5.27.1-5ubuntu0.1
libdjvulibre-text - 3.5.27.1-5ubuntu0.1
libdjvulibre21 - 3.5.27.1-5ubuntu0.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: djvulibre package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.5.27.1-5ubuntu0.1').
